title: Single object detection and boxing

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Help from the community is welcome

body:
I'm having a use case where I do not only have to classify an image on a (small) set of categories, but I also need to do a really basic object detection, that can be accomplished via the image classification itself, since it will always be a single object in the image, but I will also need to have a rough estimate on where a specific feature of this object is, in order to perform further analysis on that part of the image.
I cannot complete this using other techniques, because the object I'm focusing on can be easily identified by a human, but has subtle variances between each instance that forces the solution into an AI-driven approach.

Is there some simplification in implementing some sort of single object detection into Ludwig, as opposite to a multi-object detection, or can that be naively trained with an image input and adding some numeric outputs (for ROI coordinates) ?

In the latter, a simple custom "box" output type extension, that wraps around existing numerical output features could be useful in abstracting this to a higher level.

I know you are focused on bugs, and I could take on this extension, but I wanted to pick your mind in the feasibility of such an approach.

Bye!
